person.persName: Benjamin H. Howser (Spencer County, Kentucky, farmer and 1st lieutenant in 15th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.))

body.p: Spencer County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John Howser and Sarah Clark Howser. Married to Eliza J. Ruble Howser in Spencer County on May 3, 1852. Married to Mary Howser. Father of Eliza Howser. Farmer in Spencer County in 1850. Farmer in Spencer County in 1860. Employed Mark Rucker as blacksmith, Barnett Jewell as farm laborer, and James Pullam as farm laborer in Spencer County in 1860. Owned one enslaved individual in Spencer County in 1860. Mustered in as 1st lieutenant in the 15th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) on November 6, 1861.
